content.description:
A massive detached boulder towards the west/climber's right end of the front face of the area (the one facing the river).  If you've spent as much time by yourself in the woods as I have, its two-tier structure of a square with flat faces topped by a pointy cap looks like a house.  And is about as big.   
  
 Each face has a distinct character.  The front and climber's right side have good, crimpy routes with difficult topouts and bone-crushing falls.  The left side has big, cracked, and blocky routes that go all the way up.  The back side is an overhanging playground of thin crimps and difficult slopers. 
  
 The way the House has detached from the back wall also creates two walls of tall rock that have a variety of features and routes.  These are also included in this sub-section.
